results.title: Pasta presto!
results.brief_description: Join Helen Baetz, chef and owner of Pasta Impromptu restaurant, on a guided tour through the delights of pasta. Beginning with how to select pasta, and an introduction to the different types of pasta, Helen then shows how to make fresh pasta, how to cook it and a trio of simple sauces for pasta. Concluding with a recipe for Mexican pasta salad, and a demonstration of how to serve and eat pasta this video is a useful introduction to the world of pasta.

results.title: Past, present and promise
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Discovering psychology”.
In this first program Philip Zimbardo introduces us to the fascinating science of psychology, a science at the crossroads of a wide variety of subjects such as philosophy, anthropology, biochemistry and artificial intelligence. He outlines what psychologists do and some of the different approaches taken to the study of the brain, mind and behaviour, including a brief history of psychology.

results.title: Past is prologue: a camera view of a new Norway
results.brief_description: Contrasts the 1100th anniversary of Tonsberg with industry and modern technology. Looks briefly at heavy industry, ship-building, the commissioning of a new oil tanker, and the extent of off-shore drilling. Modern sculpture and space age architecture finish this survey of the new Norway.

results.title: Past and future
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War in the Air”.
A discussion of the ways in which aeroplanes have been developed since the First World War as a pointer to the way they will develop in the future. A brief resume of the development of the warplane from the First to the Second World War, and of the strategic implications of new weapons in modern air war. Atomic and hydrogen bomb experiments; modern defences - fighter, radar, rockets; long range offensive weapons - rockets, carrier forces, V bombers; and lastly, the web of strategic air forces covering a diminished world.

results.title: Passport to Pimlico
results.creator_credit: Henry Cornelius, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
This was the first classic Ealing comedy. An ancient document reveals that London’s Pimlico district really belongs to France. The community eager to abandon post-War constraints, particularly rationing establish their independence as a ration-free state with hilarious results. Stars Stanley Holloway, Hermione Baddeley and the wonderful Margaret Rutherford.

results.title: Passionless moments
results.brief_description: A series of suburban vignettes dealing with everyday eccentricities. Filmed in black and white, this is an early work by renowned New Zealand filmmaker Jane Campion. Through a series of alternately ironic and bizarre vignettes, the filmmaker composes a joyful celebration to the beauty of the mundane and the ordinary.
